sentences.english: Big success comes from small, consistent changes.

definition: many hairs make a fur coat (idiom); many small contributions add up to sth big/many a mickle makes a muckle
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
sand grains accumulate to make a tower a tower (idiom); by gathering small amounts one gets a huge quantity/many a mickle makes a muckle
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
Many little things add up to sth great./Many little drops make an ocean. (idiom)

an ant hole may cause the collapse of a great dike (idiom)/huge damage may result from a moment's negligence

definition: to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently

definition: It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom). A good education program takes a long time to develop.
